sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
Consider the below figure. It is given that NOP and PRS are two triangles where ON is parallel to PR . Also, \(NS : NP = 5 : 7 \). Now, 
itemize{}
\item Prove that \(\Delta NQS \sim \Delta PRS \)
\item Find NQ if \(PR = 8 \)
\item If QS is parallel to OP , find ratio of areas of triangles NQS and NOP .
tikzpicture{}
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "
Considering triangles NQS and PRS , we have
\[
	\angle NSQ = \angle PSR
\]
\[
	\angle \input[s1v1]{}\input[s1v2]{}\input[s1v3]{} = \angle RPS 
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
So, we can write
\[
	\Delta NQS \sim \Delta PRS 
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "
It is given that
\[
	\frac{NS }{NP } = \frac{\input[s3v1]{} }{7 }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow 7 NS = 5 (NS + SP )
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow 2 NS = 5 SP 
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{NS }{SP } = \frac{\input[s3v2]{} }{\input[s3v3]{} }
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "$$\text{
As we already proved that $\Delta NQS \sim \Delta PRS $,}$$ 
\[
	\frac{NQ }{PR } = \frac{\input[s4v1]{}\input[s4v2]{} }{SP }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{NQ }{8 } = \frac{5 }{2 }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow NQ = \input[s4v3]{}
\]"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "
It is given that QS is parallel to OP , so
\[
	\angle \input[s5v1]{}\input[s5v2]{}\input[s5v3]{} = \angle NOP 
\]
In triangles NQS and NOP , we got 
\[
	\angle N = \angle N 
\]"}, {"id": "s6", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
So, we can write that
\[
	\Delta NQS \sim \Delta NOP 
\]"}, {"id": "s7", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
So, we can write
\[
	\frac{\textrm{area of }\Delta NQS }{\textrm{area of } \Delta NOP } = \frac{NS ^2}{NP ^2}
\]
\[
	= \frac{\input[s7v1]{} }{\input[s7v2]{} }
\]
\newline

"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": ["Q", "N", "S"], "text": "$$\text{$\angle NSQ = \angle PSR${Vertically opposite angles}, and $\angle QNS = \angle RPS ${alternate interior angles}.}$$ "}, {"data": [], "text": " "}, {"data": [5, 5, 2], "text": "$$\text{Upon further simplification of $\frac{NS }{NP } = \frac{5 }{7 }$, we get $\frac{NS }{SP } \frac{5 }{2 }$}$$"}, {"data": ["N", "S", 20.0], "text": "$$\text{Since, $$\Delta NQS \sim \Delta PRS $, therefore, $\frac{NQ }{PR } = \frac{NS }{SP }$, and hence, $NQ = 20.0 $.}$$"}, {"data": ["N", "Q", "S"], "text": "$$\text{$\angle NQS = \angle NOP$,{corresponding angles are equal}.}$$ "}, {"data": [], "text": " "}, {"data": [25, 49], "text": "$$\text{$\frac{\textrm{area of }\Delta NQS }{\textrm{area of } \Delta NOP } = \frac{NS ^2}{NP ^2}= \frac{25 }{49 }$, as the ratio of the area of similar triangles is equal to the square of the ratio of the corresponding sides.}$$ "}]
